results.title: Bette Davis' eyes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Filmstruck Series”.
What makes a star? Clips from a host of films look at the legendary stars - Sarah Bernhardt, Shirley Temple, Joan Crawford, Errol Flynn and Bette Davis. This program is episode seven in the ten part documentary, “Filmstruck”, which considers the impact of cinema on the social and personal life of the viewing audience.

results.title: Betsy's wedding
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Louis A. Stroller, Martin Bregman and Alan Alda
results.brief_description: Directed by Alan Alda, “Betsy’s wedding” is about a father (Alda) who must survive his daughter’s wedding, with all its fractious factions, complications, cost, deal making and emotional turmoil. An intermittently amusing work, with the highlight being Anthony La Paglia’s turn as a mobster’s nephew who falls for the bride’s policewoman sister. Cast also includes Joey Bishop, madeline Kahn, Molly Ringwald, Joe Pesci, Ally Sheedy.

results.title: Betrayed by a handprint
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: Society lady turned thief gets caught out when she leaves her hand print at the scene of the crime. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Harry Solter, Linda arvidson, Kate Bruce, Gene Gauntier, George Gebhardt, Mack Sennett. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: Bethune
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Kemeny and Donald Brittain
results.brief_description: A documentary on the life of Dr Norman Bethune, who opened up Spain’s first blood bank during the Spanish Civil War, and went to China where he acted as doctor on the famous “long march”. Using graphic film clips, stills and interviews with colleagues Dr Bethune’s legendary career is presented.

results.title: Best of friends
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Film Australia and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Six stories featuring the courageous pink elephant and his friends who amongst the clutter in Michael’s bedroom. The stories are: “Beginnings”, “Under the bed”, “Best of friends”, “The Thing outside”, “Helpless”, and “Moving house”.

results.title: Best of British: Triumph
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
Triumph is one of the greatest names in British motorcycle history. This documentary follows the story of the Triumph motorcycle from its beginnings in Coventry just after the turn of the century, to its resurrection in the late eighties. The turbulent history of the Triumph company is revealed through interviews with key figures associated with the Triumph name and significant Triumph models of the past and present are discussed in detail.

results.title: Best of British: the official red arrows 1995/96 World Tour
results.creator_credit: Jonathon McNicholas, Tony Wall and R.E. W
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
Witness the Royal Air Force Aerobatic Team, the Red Arrows, in their distinctive red British Aerospace Hawk aircraft, achieve the epitome of flying and technical proficiency. This program follows the team to locations in the Middle East, South Africa, Zimbabwe and Australia as they perform precisely choreographed maneuvers in their spectacular aerial displays.

results.title: Best of British: Rolls Royce
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cox and Synchro Sports Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Best of British”.
This documentary on the world’s most prestigious car maker, features all the significant Rolls-Royce models from the earliest Silver Ghost and classic Phantoms to the latest Silver Spirit and Flying Spur. A high percentage of all the Roll-Royces ever made are still in existence. Unique footage from the factory shows how the company applies the tradition and standards of almost 90 years of car manufacture to today’s technology.
